results.title: A Conversation with B.F. Skinner (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordan, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: In his book Beyond Freedom and Dignity, Dr. B. F. Skinner rejects the general belief that within each individual there is an “inner man” immune to environmental shaping. In discussion with Elizabeth Hall of Psychology Today magazine, he illuminates the origins of behaviorism and some of its basic principles and argues the need for a culture designed by behaviorists. Within this context, he explores the notion of control, its use and potential misuse, punishment and freedom.

results.title: A Communications primer
results.brief_description: This visually beautiful film was a first in a lot of ways: the Eameses’ first film scored by Elmer Bernstein, their first to deal with specific intellectual content, and the film that introduced their work to IBM. The elegant and clear statement remains essential viewing for the Media Age. The film deals with the ways in which human beings obtain their essential knowledge of the outside world. It has not always been recognised that communications consist of something more than the transmission of facts or symbols, and a mere facility for handling certain devices. What is required is an understanding of the human attributes and processes which control the passage of information from one person to another. The film will help discourage a limited view of communications. There are a number of philosophical implications, and some good illustrative samples on the concept of noise in a communication system, and provocative photographic symbolism about the power of words to add or detract to human knowledge. Music by Elmer Bernstein, sound by Barry Eddy.

results.title: A Civilised malady
results.creator_credit: John Sexton and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: An investigation of the causes, incidence, social impact and cures of one of modern civilisations most insidious diseases, high blood pressure. Common salt is suspected of being the prime cause of this disease. In Australia one in six adults suffer from hypertension, but only half of those affected know that they have it.

results.title: A City speaks
results.creator_credit: Paul Rotha, Films of Fact and Manchester City Corporation
results.brief_description: While dealing specifically with Manchester, England, this film is also intended to give a general picture of local government in England. A summary of Manchester’s growth through the centuries is given, stressing the rapid growth during the industrial revolution. Manchester’s past achievements and future plans are shown in some detail. Sequences showing Manchester at play are cut to the music of Wagner’s “Ride of the Valkyries”. The concluding sequences show citizens going about their work, while the commentary stresses that the city is its people.

results.title: A City awakens
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film showing the sights and sounds of a city as it gradually comes to life in the early morning. The film begins before dawn until each part awakens. As the city prepares for the day, the rhythm builds and builds.

results.title: A City's child
results.creator_credit: Brian Kavanagh, Experimental Film and Television Fund of the Australian Council for the Arts and Kavanagh Productions
results.brief_description: An award-winning dramatic treatment of individual loneliness in a large city. Monica Maughan plays a spinster approaching middle age who lives with a dominating mother. After the death of her mother, unable to make human contact, she slips into a fantasy world in which a small doll becomes her “daughter”. The film was shot on 16mm for about $30,000.

results.title: A Citizen of Singapore
results.creator_credit: Brian Salt, Gaumont-British Instructional and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Through the story of a seven-year-old, Hung Swee Kiat, the film outlines the scope and progress of Singapore’s Ten Year Development Scheme to provide free education for all children, regardless of race and creed. The film closes with official ceremonies at a youth rally which concluded Education Week, during which exhibitions and displays brought the Scheme to the notice of the public.

results.title: A Circus story
results.creator_credit: Marshall Riggan, Major Carpenter, Barr Films and Marshall Majors Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the arrival, setting up and the performance of a circus in the small town of Berrybille, Arkansas, USA. Discusses the status, role and function of the circus today and suggests reasons for the romantic appeal of the circus. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Christmas dream [English version]
results.creator_credit: Karel Zeman and United World Films
results.brief_description: A fantasy in which a little girl’s toys come to life in a dream - the toys being played by Puppets. (The film is noteworthy for the excellence of the puppet animation in the original material - for American distribution, introductory and concluding sequences have been added to the film by Castle Films, USA.). This film was directed by Karel Zeman at the Gottwaldov Puppet Studios, Czechoslovakia.
